title-group.article-title: The Development of a Turbine Engine Maintenance Program from a New Reliability Model

permissions.copyright-statement: Â© Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc., 1974

abstract.p: In the last 12 years new conclusions have been reached concerning the traditional reliability model for turbine aircraft engines. The overhaul of engines at one point in time has been discarded. New maintenance processes called "On Condition" and "Condition Monitoring" have been defined. A simple decision diagram has been devised to determine the proper maintenance process for each part. The historical background for these new conclusions, the maintenance decision diagram, and a new maintenance program called Powerplant LIBRA are discussed in this paper.

ref.mixed-citation: F. S. Nowlan, " 'On Condition' Philosophies From a Planning and Operational Viewpoint; Past-Present-Future." Fifteenth Meeting of IATA Production Planning and Control Subcommittee, Belgrade, Yugoslavia, October 1969.
R&M Subcommittee, "Airline/Manufacturer Mainte- nance Program Planning Document, MSG-2." Air Transport Association, March 1970.
T. D. Matteson, "Air Transport Maintenance Technology Needs a New Regulatory Model." AIAA Conference on Air Transportation and Society, Key Biscayne, June 1971.
T. D. Matteson, "The Relationship Between Maintenance and Operating Safety in Air Transportation." Seventh Annual FAA International Aviation Maintenance Symposium, Okla- homa City, December 1971.
